title: For Sale:  SOLD/MAS 49/56 308 Grenadier Rifle, Bayonet and Launcher
postcontent:
For some reason my ad has been flagged twice as a SCAM.  The rifle I have for sale is exactly as pictured and described.  Inspection will confirm that is fact.  My email is LynMyers@hotmail.com, get in touch with me.

Very Good Condition, Really Nice, Fun to shoot 308, with Bayonet, Grenade Launcher, and two clips (see photo)

The MAS-49 rifle, developed by the French state arms factory Manufacture Nationale d'Armes de St-Etienne (MAS), was a logical development of many earlier prototypes, based on the direct gas impingement system, developed by the French designer Rossignol early in the XX century. The same (or very similar) gas system was later used in Swedish Ljungman AG-42 rifle and in Eugene Stoner AR-15 / M16 rifles. France was a major player in the field of automatic rifles since the very beginning. The MAS 44 was improved to accept new, detachable magazines and modified to be able to launch rifle grenades, and then became the MAS-49, or "Fusil Automatique MAS Modele 1949".  MAS-1949 (as it was stamped on the receiver), seen heavy combat use in the French Indo-China and Algeria and proved itself accurate and reliable. In 1956, an improved pattern rifle was adopted by Armee de Terre (French Army) as a MAS-1949/56. The MAS-49/56 was lightened, had shorter barrel and forend, different grenade launcher sights and was able to be fitted with spike-shaped bayonet, while MAS-1949 could not be equipped with bayonet. MAS-49/56 served as a first-line weapon with French army until 1979, when it was replaced by the 5.56mm FAMAS assault rifle. The MAS-49 was exported in small numbers to Syria in 1950s, and still can be found in some ex-France territories around the world.

MAS-1949 is a gas operated, semi-automatic, magazine fed rifle. It uses a direct gas impingement system with no gas piston. Instead of the gas piston, the powder gases are fed from the barrel through the gas tube directly to the front face of the bolt carrier. The bolt carrier operates the tilting bolt, which is cammed down to lock into the slot in the receiver floor. The dual stack, box magazine is detachable and rifle can be reloaded with replacement magazines, but it also featured a stripper clips guides, machined into the front of the bolt carrier, so magazine could be reloaded by using two 5-round stripper clips without removal from the rifle. MAS-1949 has a bolt catch, which is engaged by the magazine follower as soon as the last round from magazine is fired. The gas system has a gas cutoff device, which is required to fire the rifle grenades from the muzzle. Special grenade sights are located at the left side of the rifle stock. Standard open sights had a hooded front sight on the front stock band and an aperture (diopter) rear sight on the receiver, which is adjustable for range from 200 to 1200 meters and for windage. All MAS-1949 rifles featured a side rail at the left side of the receiver that allows the telescopic sights to be mounted on every rifle. The safety switch in the form of the cross-bolt push-button is located at the right side of the rifle, at the front of the triggerguard. The large plastic charging handle is attached to the bolt carrier at the right side. Magazine catch built on the side of the detachable box magazine, instead of being mounted on the rifle itself, which is more usual practice. MAS-1949 has no provisions for bayonet mount, but has a stacking hook at the muzzle.

The MAS-1949/56 has shorter barrel and shorter handguards to save weight and made weapon more maneuverable. The grenade launching sights were moved to the barrel, and the gas cutoff switch is mounted at the front of the handguards above the barrel and cannot be engaged when grenade sight is lowered out of use. The barrel is equipped with combination muzzle brake / grenade launching device. Like the MAS-1949, all MAS-1949/56 rifles have the scope rails on the left side of the receiver, and thus could be used as a designated marksmen rifles at the distances up to 600 meters or so.

title: For Sale:  Custom built precision AR15. Fun varminter or benchrest rifle!
postcontent:
This rifle is a like-new AR15 platform rifle that was built in February 2012. This rifle has only been to the range a half dozen times and has been well cleaned and maintained. 

Here are some pros to this weapon:

- The .223/5.56 is cheaper to fire than other long-range alternatives such as the popular .308 round.
- The versatility and modularity of the AR platform is unmatched if you choose to customize this rifle in the future.
- If you own or plan on owning another AR15, parts and ammunition will be interchangeable with this long-range version.
- The minimal recoil from the smaller round (again in comparison to other common long-range options) allows for comfortable shooting and quick and accurate followup shots.
- 30 round magazine.


My reason for selling this fun toy is that my wife and I are expecting our first child this summer. The time and money normally spent on shooting will need to go elsewhere. The rifle is a blast to shoot and has HUGE Muzzle Flashes!

Rare French 1895 Chatellerault Berthier Carbine Model 1892 in 8mm Lebel.  This rifle is extremely difficult to find, especially in the US.  It is extra rare due to the fact it did not go through the re-barreling process of the French Army, which most of these rifles did. title: For Sale/Trade:  Kahr T9 Novak Stainless 9MM
postcontent: For sale/trade is a LNIB Kahr T9 Tactical. It has the stainless steel slide and frame with Pau Ferro hardwood grips and bright (2010) Novak 3 dot night sights. It comes with 2 8 round stainless magazines, factory case, manuals, trigger lock, hang tag, spare black steel guide rod, Kahr swag (pin, catalogs and hat). It has a stainless steel guide rod installed. The serial number indicates that it was built in mid to early 2011 and I have put about 200 rounds through it with no issues at all. The trigger on this pistol is extremely smooth and breaks clean, it features the shorter pull target trigger which lets off about 1/8" sooner than the standard Kahr trigger. It really is the Cadillac of the Kahr lineup. The small grip on the Kahr series doesnt agree with my hand and shooting stance, this one is really effective as a one handed gun if you have medium/large hands and fits the ladies perfectly. I am really looking for something to use in IDPA, or a really nice carry gun for vacation (and when IL passes CCW).

title: For Sale:  P9R 9mm Pistol - Browning Hi-Power Variant - Like new
postcontent:
For sale is a practically brand new P9R 9MM pistol. This is a Browning Hi-Power Variant and is an exact copy of that renowned pistol. Anyone that really knows pistols is familliar with the Browning Hi-Power and the respect it demands. This pistol is the Hungarian version of that very pistol in every conceivable detail. Made in Hungary by the FEGARMY Arms factory.

The P9R is a short recoil operated, locked breech pistol. The barrel is operated using a Browning cam system, and is locked to slide by three locking lugs on the top of the barrel, which fit into mated recesses on the inside of the slide, just ahead of the ejection port. Frame and slide are made from carbon steel and has a blued finish. The Double Action trigger system with external hammer has a slide-mounted safety lever, which also works as a decocker when safety is engaged. 

It comes with one 14-round (YES, 14 ROUNDS!)double stack magazine and carrying case.

title: For Sale:  Sig 522 Classic
postcontent:
Sig 522 for sale. Bought new, a little over a year old, good condition except for what is mostly a cosmetic issue. 

I was trying to do a modification to the storage tube inside of the 'gas block' (its not really a gas block and is purely aesthetic, its what would be the gas block on the sig 556) to mount a laser sight in there. Unfortunately, I sheered off a screw tap and haven't been able to get it out due to lacking the proper tools to do so. I also had to cut the storage tube off to allow the front end piece to be snapped back into place as a result. The end result of this whole thing is there is a screw tap snapped off inside of the cosmetic-only " gas block " and it no longer has a storage tube. When the front end-cap is in place, you can't tell that anything is wrong.

Function is flawless and I would never have attempted the above if there were any chance that it would effect function. With the proper tools it shouldn't be hard to get the tap out and finish the mod. A cheap laser sight to use for that purpose is included and is mounted on the front rail.

Also includes a foregrip and a total of 3 Sig 26 round magazines and a BSA red dot. Also it has the tri-rails mounted on the front of the grip, these too, are an option and don't come on the gun new. I'll throw in some 22lr ammo as well to get you going in the unlikely event you don't already have a 22lr gun.

This thing has fired every 22lr I have thrown at it. It runs excellently.

This is probably the best of the 'tacticool' 22s, in my opinion. 

Because of the cosmetic issue I'm going to let it go pretty cheap for a Sig 522. First $350 gets it. (They are $450+ New without said accessories.)

I have an M&P listed in the Handguns section too. Whichever goes first wins, I keep the other.

I am in Steubenville but don't mind a moderate drive to meet halfway.

title: For Sale:  Advantage Arms Glock .22 Conversion kit
postcontent:
We have a new in box Advantage Arms .22 Caliber Conversion Kit with cleaning kit and case. Fits: G17, G17L, G22, G31, G34, G35 and G37. 
Comes with .22 magazine, speed loader and full cleaning kit. This is a great addition to your gun. Comes see us in Ozark. We buy sell and trade.
REDACTED
Doc Hollidays General Store
721 N 10th St 
Ozark Mo 65721

Six great reasons to purchase our .22 LR conversion kit

1.  ADJUSTABLE SIGHTS
The front and rear sights are removable GLOCK OEM sights. The rear sight is adjustable for both windage and elevation. 

2.  LAST ROUND LOCK OPEN
The slide will lock open after the last round in the magazine has been fired. Our unique patented magazine design and heat-treated steel lock open insert allows us to offer this special and desirable feature which you can only find on 'Advantage Arms' .22LR GLOCK conversion kits.

3.  INTERNAL FIRING PIN SAFETY
Glock incorporated an internal firing pin safety into their guns. We thought it was important enough to include it on our conversion kits as well. Our internal firing pin safety is designed to eliminate accidental discharges from dropping the firearm. 

4.  FINISH
All Aluminum parts are Anodized Per Mil-A-8625 with a matte black finish. All steel parts are heat treated with a Black Oxide Finish. The barrel is made from heat treated 416 Stainless Steel.

5.  THE 10 SECOND INSTALLATION
Installation is simple and does not require any modifications to your GLOCK pistol. Simply remove the GLOCK magazine and slide as outlined in your GLOCK owner's manual. Now slide the "Advantage Arms" slide onto the frame, until it engages with the slide lock. Check to make sure that the slide lock is in its most upward position. Insert the conversion magazine. You are now ready to shoot.

This procedure can be accomplished in less than 10 seconds with some practice.

6.  ONE YEAR FACTORY DIRECT WARRANTY
Warranty covers any defects in materials or workmanship.

title: For Sale:  CUSTOM Monolithic 16” SS match grade 223/556 AR15
postcontent:
CUSTOM Monolithic 16” SS match grade 223/556 AR15  

(TOTAL PRICE $1,700 - Trijicon ACOG NOT INCLUDED)

This is a NEW completely custom built AR15 rifle and requires the normal FFL check/transfer.

This particular build is Duracoated DP Brown and utilizes a Magpul MOE stock and ergo tactical deluxe grip.  I have also added an oversize charging handle latch and a forward vertical grip that can be removed or relocated with a push of a  button.  I installed a standard lower parts kit and the standard trigger group is modified to remove creep and  to allow it to have a cleaner brake when pulled.  It includes 1 20 round pmag.  

On this build, I utilized the MEAGA Arms rifle length MTS (Monolithic) receiver, a low profile gas block, and a mid length impingement tube in order to install the necessary gas components under the monolithic rail making a very clean, minimal look.  I have used these barrels on a number of occasions and the accuracy and consistency is excellent.

The following is a list of the major components used for this build and links to review specific details of each component.

MEAGA Arms Monolithic Tactical System (MTS) rifle length quad rail upper receiver
(http://megamachineshop.com/armscatalog/MTS-QUAD/loader.html)

(http://megamachineshop.com/armscatalog/006BILLETLOWER-GTR-3H/loader.html)

16” .223 Wylde (.223/5.56) Stainless Steel Match grade Shilen blanks with A2 flash hider
(http://www.rainierarms.com/?page=shop/detail&product_id=809)

Lewis Machine & Tool Bolt carrier assembly
(http://www.rainierarms.com/?page=shop/detail&product_id=112)


This is an extremely high quality gun using only high quality components as well as time and attention to detail was taken to assure both cosmetic appeal, reliable, and accurate operation.  TOTAL PRICE $1,700  (with out sights)
